metadata.title: CVE-2018-16062 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
dwarf_getaranges in dwarf_getaranges.c in libdw in elfutils before2018-08-18 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-basedbuffer over-read) via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16062` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

debuginfod - 0.176-1.1
elfutils - 0.176-1.1
libasm1 - 0.176-1.1
libdebuginfod-common - 0.176-1.1
libdebuginfod1 - 0.176-1.1
libdw1 - 0.176-1.1
libelf1 - 0.176-1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: elfutils package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.176-1.1').
